org.spongepowered.api.service.persistence.data

Class DataQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.service.persistence.data.DataQuery

  • public final class DataQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a query that can be done on views. Queries do not depend on their separator, it is just a way to construct them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataQuery(char separator, java.lang.String path)
      Constructs a query using the given separator character and path.
      DataQuery(java.util.List<java.lang.String> parts)
      Constructs a query using the given parts.
      DataQuery(java.lang.String... parts)
      Constructs a query using the given parts.
      DataQuery(java.lang.String separator, java.lang.String path)
      Constructs a query using the given separator and path.

    • Method Summary

      Gets the parts that make up this query.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataQuery

        public DataQuery(java.lang.String separator,
                 java.lang.String path)
        Constructs a query using the given separator and path.

        As an example, new Query("/", "a/b/c") and new Query(".", "a.b.c") represent the same path but are constructed using different separators.

        Parameters:
        separator - The separator
        path - The path

      • DataQuery

        public DataQuery(char separator,
                 java.lang.String path)
        Constructs a query using the given separator character and path.

        As an example, new Query('/', "a/b/c") and new Query('.', "a.b.c") represent the same path but are constructed using different separators.

        Parameters:
        separator - The separator
        path - The path
